work.name: Technische Universität München, Munich, Germany
work.summary: Focusing on machine learning methods for fluid simulations, including continuous convolutions and graph neural networks, and the development of differentiable fluid solvers.
highlights: Applied machine learning techniques to enhance fluid simulations.
Developed differentiable fluid solvers for improved simulation accuracy.

work.name: Universität Siegen, Siegen, Germany
work.summary: Research on Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) with a focus on adaptive SPH methods, boundary handling, and fluid-structure interaction.
highlights: Developed adaptive SPH methods for fluid simulations.
Implemented boundary handling techniques for SPH.

work.name: Universität Siegen, Siegen, Germany
work.summary: Conducted research on Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) with a focus on GPU-based implementations and the development of a pressure solver for incompressible SPH.
highlights: Developed a pressure solver for incompressible SPH.
Implemented GPU-based SPH methods for enhanced performance.

awards.title: Krombacher IT Prize
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding contributions in the field of IT and computer science.

awards.title: GI/GDV Masters Thesis Award
awards.awarder: Gesellschaft für Informatik (GI) and Gesellschaft für Datenverarbeitung (GDV)
awards.summary: Recognized for excellence in master's thesis research in computer science.

awards.title: Honorable Mention at the VMV Conference
awards.summary: Received an honorable mention for contributions to the VMV Conference.

projects.name: diffSPH
projects.summary: A differentiable Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) framework for fluid simulations, enabling the integration of machine learning techniques into SPH methods.
